title: England will be applauded for handling of racist abuse but to send out the strongest message this match should have been abandoned
text:
Tyrone Mingssaid that the England players first heard it in the warm-up, although it was almost an hour later, in the 27th minute that the Croatian referee called Harry Kane over for a conversation that looked like the beginning of a seminal moment in the history of football.

The black players in the England team had been so persistently racially abused by the crowd in the half-full Vasil Levski National Stadium by then it was reaching the point where the Uefa protocol was being activated. That the stadium was half-full partly because of a previous Uefa punishment for racist behaviour was not lost on those who could hear the monkey chants and see the “Equal Game” Uefa banners on the empty seats....
